title: Quiz 2 - Partnership
instruction: Which options satisfy the blanks in below question.

quiz.text: Arun, Sameer and Sohan are partners. Arun receives  of the profit and the rest is shared by Sohan and Sameer equally. Arun’s income is increased by Rs.225 when the profit rises from 8% to 13%. Find the individual capital invested by Sameer and Sohan each.
options: Rs 1800
Rs 2000
Rs 2500
Rs 950
None of these

quiz.text: A, B and C are partners in a business with capitals of Rs. 5000, Rs. 6000, and Rs. 4000 respectively. A gets 30% of the profit for managing the business and the balance is divided by the ratio of their capital. At the end of the year A gets Rs. 200 more than B and C together. Find the total profit.
options: Rs. 3000
Rs. 3600
Rs. 2500
Rs. 3500
None of these

quiz.text: Aman and Akanksha enter into a partnership by investing Rs 9000 and Rs 8000 respectively. After 3 months Aman withdraws Rs 2500 while Akanksha invests Rs 2500 More. After another 3 months, Anurup joins the business with a capital of Rs 15000. The share of profit of Akanksha exceeds that of Anurup out of total profit of Rs 29400 by?
options: Rs 4850
Rs 2850
Rs 4250
Rs 3450
None of these

quiz.text: A, B, and C invested capital in the ratio 7 : 3: 2. At the end of the business term, they received the profits in the ratio 2 : 3 : 7. Find the ratio of time for which they contributed their capital.
options: 49 : 14 : 4
4 : 49 : 14
4 : 14 : 49
41 : 49 : 4
None of these

quiz.text: A puts Rs 280 more in a business than B, but B has invested his capital for 3 months while A has invested his for 4 months. If the share of A is Rs 55 more than that of B out of the total profits of Rs 245, find the total capital in the business.
options: Rs 1520
Rs 1800
Rs 3320
Data inadequate
None of these

quiz.text: Abhishek started a business investing Rs 50,000. After one year he invested another Rs 30,000 and Sudhir also joined him with a capital of Rs 70,000. If the profit earned in three years from the starting of business was Rs 87,500 then find the share of Sudhir in the profit.
options: Rs 37,500
Rs 35,000
Rs 38,281
Rs 52,500
None of these

quiz.text: A and B invested Rs. 60,000 and Rs. 80,000 respectively in a business. A receives Rs. 100 per month out of profit for running the business and the rest of the profit is divided in the ratio of investments. If A receives Rs. 3,900 annually, B receives :
options: Rs. 3,200
Rs. 2,700
Rs. 3,600
Rs. 2,925
None of these

quiz.text: X and Y are partners in a business. X contributed one-third of the capital for 9 months and Y received two-fifths of the profits. For how long was Y’s money used in the business ?
options: 4 months
3 months
2 months
5 months
None of these

quiz.text: A invest  part of total capital for  time. B invests  part of total capital for  time and C invest the rest capital for full time. If the total profit at the end of year is Rs. 23,000, find the share of B.
options: Rs. 3000
Rs. 4800
Rs. 3500
Rs. 4000
None of these

quiz.text: Three friends A, B and C started a venture with capitals in the ratio of 4 : 1 : 15. At the end of every quarter A halves his capital, while B doubles his capital and C leaves his capital untouched. This process is repeated till the end of the year. If at the end of the year B’s share of profit is Rs. 22,000, what is the total profit ?
options: Rs. 88,000
Rs. 1,10,000
Rs. 1,21,000
Rs. 99,000
None of these

quiz.text: A and B enter into a partnership with Rs 50,000 and Rs 60,000 respectively. C joins them after x months contributing Rs 70,000 and B leaves x months before the end of the year. If they share the profit in the ratio of 20 : 18 : 21, then find the value of x.
options: 9 months
3 months
6 months
8 months
None of these

quiz.text: A started a business with an investment of Rs 28,000. After 5 months from the start of the business, B and C joined with Rs 24,000 and Rs 32,000 respectively and A withdrew Rs 8000 from the business. If the difference between A’s share and B’s share in the annual profit is Rs 2,400, then what was the annual profit received?
options: Rs 15,600
Rs 14,400
Rs 14,040
Rs 15,360
Rs 13,440

quiz.text: A, B and C enter into a partnership. A invests Rs. 4000 for the whole year, B puts in Rs. 6000 at the first and increasing to  Rs. 8000 at the end of 4 months, whilst C puts in at first Rs. 8000 but withdraw Rs. 2000 a the end of 9 months. Find the profit of A at the end of year, if the total profit is Rs. 16950.
options: Rs. 3600
Rs. 6600
Rs. 6750
Rs. 6300
None of these

quiz.text: A, B and C started a business with their investments in the ratio 1 : 2 : 4. After 6 months A invested half the amount more as before and B invested same the amount as before while C withdrew 1/4th of the his investment. Find the ratio of their profits at the end of the year.
options: 5 : 12 : 13
5 : 11 : 14
5 : 12 : 14
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text: P, Q and R invested Rs. 45,000, Rs. 70,000 and Rs. 90,000 respectively to start a business. At the end of two years, they earned a profit of Rs. 1,64,000. What will be Q’s share in the profit?
options: Rs. 56,000
Rs. 35,000
Rs. 72,000
Rs. 64,000
None of these

quiz.text: Rs. 165 was distributed between two persons in such a way that for an amount of Rs. 1.50 given to one, another will get an amount of Rs. 1.25. What will be the difference in their shares ?
options: Rs. 15
Rs. 30
Rs. 22.5
Rs. 37.5
None of these

quiz.text: M, P and Q together started a business. M invested Rs. 6,500 for 6 months, P invested Rs. 8,400 for 5 months and Q invested Rs. 10,000 for 3 months. M is working member for which he gets 5% of total profit extra. If the total gain is Rs. 7,400, then Q’s share is:
options: Rs. 1,900
Rs. 2,100
Rs. 3,200
Rs. 2,000
None of these

quiz.text: Aman started a business by investing Rs 56000. After 5 months, Bharti joined him with a capital of Rs 48000. At the end of the year Bharti received Rs 3250 as share of profit. What is the total profit at the end of the year?
options: Rs 9650
Rs 9750
Rs 6500
Rs 9700
None of these

quiz.text: Three partners A, B and C invested their amounts in ratio of 3 : 5 : 7. At the end of four months, A invests some amount such that, his total investment will be equal to C’s initial investment if C’s share in profit is Rs 3150. Then total annual profit will be ?
options: Rs. 8150
Rs. 7950
Rs. 8000
Rs. 7500
None of these

quiz.text: A starts business with a capital of Rs 1200. B and C join with some investments after 3 and 6 months, respectively. If at the end of a year, the profit is divided in the ratio 2 : 3 : 5 respectively, what is B’s investment in the business?
options: Rs. 2400
Rs. 180
Rs. 3600
Rs. 6000
5500

quiz.text: A, B and C enter into a partnership. A invests Rs. 8000 for the whole year, B puts in Rs. 12000 at the first and increasing to  Rs. 16000 at the end of 4 months, whilst C puts in at first Rs. 16000 but withdraw Rs. 4000 at the end of 9 months. Find the profit of A at the end of year, if the total profit is Rs. 22600.
options: Rs. 4800
Rs. 4600
Rs. 4750
Rs. 4300
none of these

quiz.text: P and Q entered into partnership investing Rs 12000 and Rs 16000 respectively. After 8 months, R also joins the business with a capital of Rs 15000. The share of R in a profit of Rs 45600 after 2 years will be :
options: Rs. 24000
Rs. 16000
Rs. 12000
Rs. 11400
None of these

quiz.text: A and B entered into partnership with Rs 700 and Rs 600 respectively. After 3 months A withdrew  of his stock but after 3 months more he put back  of what he had withdrawn. The profits at the end of the year are Rs 726, how much of this should A receive?
options: Rs 633
Rs 336
Rs 663
Rs 366
None of these

quiz.text: P and Q started a business by investing Rs. 15,000 and Rs.18,000 respectively. After four months R joined the business with a capital of Rs. 10,000. After two more months Q left the business with his capital. At the end of the year P got a share of Rs. 4,500 in the profit. What is the total profit earned?
options: Rs 6800
Rs 7600
Rs 8600
Rs 9200
none of these

quiz.text: X, Y and Z enter into partnership. X invests  part of total capital for one-fourth of the time. Y contributes one fifth of the capital for half of the time. Z contributes the remaining capital for the whole time. How should they divided a profit of Rs. 1140?
options: Rs. 100, Rs. 160, Rs. 880
Rs. 120, Rs. 140, Rs. 880
Rs. 120, Rs. 150, Rs. 840
Rs. 140, Rs. 170, Rs. 830
None of these

quiz.text: Gaurav, Vivek and Neeraj enter into partnership by making investments in the ratio 3 : 5 : 7. After a year, Neeraj invests another Rs. 337600 while Gaurav withdraws Rs. 45600. The ratio of investments then changes to 24 : 59 : 167. How much did Gaurav invest initially?
options: Rs. 45600
Rs. 96000
Rs. 141600
Rs. 156000
None of these

quiz.text: Two partners invest Rs 6280 and Rs 3768 respectively in a business and agree that 30% of the profit should be divided equally between them and the remaining profit is to be treated as interest on capital. If one partner gets Rs 700 more than the other, find the total profit made in the business.
options: Rs. 4000
Rs. 3800
Rs. 4125
Rs. 4500
None of these

quiz.text: A, B and C are partners. A receives  of the profit and B and C share the remaining profit equally. A’s income is increased by Rs. 550 when the profit rises from 11% to 13%. Find the capitals invested by B and C.
options: Rs. 4125
Rs. 4215
Rs. 4251
Rs. 4512
None of these

quiz.text: The profit at the end of year is Rs 11737. If profit is shared among all of them in ratio of their investments, then the profit of Raju is how much less than that of Rancho?
options: Rs 2861
Rs 984
Rs 1331
Rs 4187
None of these

quiz.text: All of them maintain their amounts at the end of 1st year for another 12 months. What is the share of Rancho if the overall profit for only 2nd year is Rs. 22500?
options: Rs. 10000
Rs. 11250
Rs. 9725
Rs. 12050
None of these

quiz.text: What is the sum of profit of A and C together if investment of A and C together is 215% of investment of B and investment of A is 28% less than investment of C. A invested for same time as C invested.
options: Rs. 17200
Rs. 18900
Rs. 19400
Rs. 14200
None of these

quiz.text: What is the total profit of all 5 person if profit percentage of E is 50% more than profit % of D.
options: Rs. 40500
Rs. 43500
Rs. 42200
Rs. 53200
Rs. 38500

quiz.text: What is the total investment of C and E if E invested for one month more than C and ratio between the time taken by both i.e. C and E is 8 : 9
options: Rs. 48000
Rs. 47000
Rs. 46000
Rs. 49000
Rs. 50000

quiz.text: Profit of A is what % of profit of C if profit of C is  of more than profit of A.
options: 72%
75%
60%
48%
55%

quiz.text: What is the difference between the time for which investment is made by D and E if profit of D is 28% less than profit of C and investment of D is 50% of investment of E.
options: 3
4
5
6
7

quiz.text:
Donald, Narender Modi and Putin entered into a business, Donald Invested Rs 45000 and 6 months later he withdrew Rs 15000. After 3 months Modi invested Rs 135000 and Putin invested Rs 85000. After another 12 months Donald, Modi and Putin withdrew Rs 5000 Rs 45000 and Rs 25000 respectively. If the profit at the end of three years is Rs 798000.

Quantity I – Profit earned by Modi.

Quantity II– Difference between profit earned by Donald and Putin
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Shudhir invested Rs. 16000 in a scheme that earned him simple interest @ 15% per annum. After two years he withdrew the principal amount plus interest and invested the entire amount in another scheme for two years, which earned him compound interest @ 12% per annum.

Quantity I  total interest earned by Sudhir at the end of 4 years

 

Sumit lent some money to Mohit at 5% per annum simple interest. Mohit lent the entire amount to Birju on the same day at  per annum. In this transaction after a year Mohit earned a profit of Rs. 350. Find the  

Quantity II sum of money lent by Sumit to Mohit.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
X and Y entered into partnership with Rs. 700 and Rs. 600 respectively. After 3 months, X withdrew two-sevenths of his stock but after 3 months, he puts back three-fifths of what he had withdrawn. The profit at the end of the year is Rs. 726.

 

Quantity I  – Profit earned by Y.

Quantity II – Profit earned by X.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
John, Mona and Gordon, three US based business partners, jointly invested in a business project to supply nuclear fuel to India. As per their share in the investment, Gordon will receive 2/3 of the profits whereas John and Mona divide the remainder equally. It is estimated that the income of John will increase by $60 million when the rate of profit rises from 4 per cent to 7 per cent for one year.

Quantity I  – Capital of Mona.

Quantity II –
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
A, B and C enter into a partnership. A contributes Rs. 320 for 4 months, B contributes Rs. 510 for 3 months and C contributes Rs. 270 for 5 months. If the total profit is Rs. 208.

Quantity I  Profit of C.

Quantity II  average profit of A, B and C.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
What will be the difference between the share of P and the share of Q in the profit earned by P, Q & R together?

I. P, Q & R invested a total amount of Rs. 25,000 for a period of two years.

II. The profit earned at the end of two years is 30%

III. The amount invested by Q is equal to the amount invested by P & R together.
options: I only
II only
III only
All I, II & III are required to answer the question
Question cannot be answered even with the information given in all three statements.

quiz.text:
Two persons Ramu and Shyam entered into a partnership. Find the profit of Shyam.

A. Ramu and Shyam started the business with a capital of Rs 12000 and Rs 9000 respectively.

B. Ramu invested the money for two months more than Shyam.

C. Ramu’s share in the total profit at the end of first year is Rs 1500 more than that of Shyam.
options: Only A and B together
Only A and C together
Any two of them
All statements are required
Question can’t be answered even using all the statements

quiz.text:
What will be the share of R in the profit earned by V, R and A together?

I. They together earned a profit of Rs. 54000 for a period of 1 yr. 

II. R’s investment was 25% less than V’s and 50% more than A’s.

III. The profit of V is Rs. 4000 more than that of A.
options: Only I and II together
II and either I or III only
Only II
Only II and III together
None of these

quiz.text:
What is the rate of interest at which Binod has invested money?

A. The compound interest at this rate of Rs 2500 in 2 yrs is equal to the simple interest in 3 yrs of Rs 1716  at the same rate.

B. The total simple interest on an investment of Rs 12000 for 3 yrs and Rs 10000 for 5 yrs at this rate is Rs 5160.

C. In 3 yrs Rs 1500 at the same rate becomes Rs 1725 by simple interest.
options: Buy using any single statement
A and either B or C
Only C
Only B and either A or C
Any two of them

quiz.text: If total investments made by A, B and C during the year are in the ratio 3 : 5 : 4, then find the profit of B at the end of the year if the total profit at the end of the year is Rs.120000.
options: Rs. 67500
Rs. 36000
Rs. 52500
Rs. 31500
None of these

quiz.text: If the total amount invested at the end of the first quarter only is Rs.39300, at the end of second quarter only is Rs.52200 and at the end of third quarter only is Rs.68400; then find the total amount invested by all of them at the start of the year?
options: Rs. 25000
Rs. 25600
Rs. 24400
Rs. 26100
Cannot be determined

quiz.text: A and B started a business with some investments. A as a working partner, received 40% of the annual profits as salary and the remaining was equally divided among A and B. If the entire profit was divided among A’ and B in the ratio of their investments, A would have received Rs.900 less than what he actually got. B got a profit share of Rs.2100. If B’s investment is Rs.45000, A’s investment is (in Rs.)
options: Rs. 75000
Rs. 60000
Rs. 90000
Rs. 45000
None of these

quiz.text: If they had invested additional amount at the end of each quarter in the same ratio as they had invested at the end of the first quarter then what will be profit of B at the end of the year if the total profit at the end of the year is will be Rs. 17500.
options: Rs. 7500
Rs. 8750
Rs. 12500
Rs. 10000
Cannot be determined

quiz.text: Additional amount invested by B at the end of first quarter is Rs. 500 more than additional amount invested by C at the end of first quarter and average of additional investment made by all the three at the end of third quarter is Rs. 1200. If the investments made by A at the end of the first and second quarters are equal then what will be the ratio of profit sharing of A, B and C at the end of the year?
options: 7 : 8 : 5
5 : 7 : 8
5 : 8 : 7
7 : 5 : 8
None of these

quiz.text:
A, B and C entered into a partnership. If the profit earned in the business is proportional to the investment and the period of investment then, what is the profit of B if all of them invested the amount for one year and total profit is Rs. x.

A. A invested Rs. 1500 less than that of C.

B. B invested 2 times more than that of A. C invested 3 times more than that of A.

C. B invested 200 percent more than that of A and 25% less than that of C.
options: Any two of them
Either B or C alone
Any of them
All statements are required
None of these

quiz.text: A, B and C entered the business with investment of Rs.1500, Rs.1800 and Rs.1200 respectively. After 2 years A and C withdrew Rs.500 and Rs.400 respectively from their initial investment and after three more years B withdrew Rs. ---- for his initial investment. If at the end of 8 years, the sum of the profit of A and B is Rs.7000 and the total profit is Rs. -----
options: Rs.600, Rs.8800
Rs.800, Rs.9400
Rs.500, Rs.7800
Rs.700, Rs.9300
None of these

quiz.text: Prem started the business with an investment of Rs. ----------. After three months, Kavin joined the business and invested Rs.3800. At the end of the year the total profit earned is Rs.35000 and the Kavin’s share is Rs. ---------.
options: Rs.2400, Rs.19000
Rs.3600, Rs.18000
Rs.2800, Rs.17000
Rs.3200, Rs.17000
None of these

quiz.text: A and B entered into the business, A invested Rs.2550 and B invested Rs.----- for first four months after that A double his investment for next 6 months then withdrew its investment. If they got total profit of Rs.12200 after a year and A’s profit share is Rs.-----.
options: Rs.2700, Rs.6800
Rs.3000, Rs.6400
Rs.3200, Rs.7000
Rs.2500, Rs.6400
None of these

quiz.text: Three persons A, B and C enter into a partnership with the investment ratio is 12:8:9 and the time ratio is 5:4:3. B received Rs.______ more profit than C received. Average of the profit amount received by A and C together is Rs._____.
options: Rs.250, Rs.2175.
Rs.350, Rs.2610
Rs.400, Rs.3490
Rs.200, Rs.1980
None of these
